Detailed Description

Manages objects. That is, it takes care of object drawing and updating.

TODO: create subclasses to take care of mode variable if possible.

Member Data Documentation

list< iObject* > cObjectManager::objectlist

List of all objects managed by cObjectManager.

This list doesn't contain the definitive pointer to any objects, but is useful when we want to loop through all objects - we won't have to make different loops for each object type.

Definition at line 28 of file cObjectManager.h.

Referenced by add(), draw(), init(), update(), and cPlayMode::Update().

list< cPickup* > cObjectManager::pickuplist

List of pickups.

This list has the definitive pointer for all pickups.

cPlayTable cObjectManager::playtable

The playtable for the game.

See cPlayTable docs for more details. The table is kept here as only one is needed, and it gets updated with everything else.
